flawed_nl_solution:
To make 200 of the first type of shirt, they will need 200*3=<<200*3=6000>>6000 buttons.
To make 200 of the second type of shirt, they will need 200*5=<<200*5=1000>>1000 buttons.
To manufacture 200 each of both types of shirts, they will need to use 6000+1000=7000 buttons.
#### 7000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 600, not 6000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
